docTitle.titlePart:
Moisture Conditioning of
VYDYNE
®
Polyamide 66 Resins

front.div:
Moisture Conditioning of VYDYNE PA66 Resins
Tech Notes
Although not always necessary,
conditioning of nylon parts before use
is common practice. As illustrated
in Table 1, moisture increases
toughness, ductility, and dimensions
in nylon parts. In general, nylons
have a minimum moisture level that
prevents brittleness, providing the
nylon has not been degraded. This
level is approximately the level it
will be in equilibrium with a 50%
relative humidity environment. For
unreinforced Nylon 66, this moisture
level is 2% to 3%.
Methods for Moisture
Conditioning Nylon
Moisture conditioning of VYDYNE
nylon resins is commonly conducted
by one of three methods listed below.
It is important to remember that when
using any conditioning process, the
rate of moisture absorption will vary
with water temperature, as well as
part thickness. In general, this rate
will roughly double for each 2°C
increase in water temperature and
will vary inversely with the square of
the part thickness.
1. Best – Exposure to a high humidity
environment at room temperature.
2. Good – Immerse parts in water
at a temperature of 50-55°C.
3. Not Recommended – Boil parts
in water.
